Comments
I feel safe the majority of the time, you just have to be smart about when and where you walk alone.

Women of Engineering group is awesome. We have already went to the convention in Minneapolis. I am hoping to help host the National Convention for the first time at NDSU in the next four years. Wally-ball and Volleyball. Residence Hall life group. Newman Center.
Engineering majors i would definitely suggest living on the 8th and 9Th floor of Sevrinson Hall. It is so nice to be among other's that are in the same field as I am.
Rumor has it that the original President of NDSU had a pet cow and she is buried near the oldest building on campus. ( Not sure if someone was teasing me or if it is true).
NDSU has a top notch school with an awesome football team. There is always the champion football games to attend on the weekends that are amazing.

There is so much to do. You can go to shows on campus, dances or even game night at the wellness center. Also teams for all types of sports. I am currently playing on a Volleyball and Wally-ball team.
Food has been wonderful. They have tea and drinks available 24/7. There is always something available that you will like to eat. I eat better now then I did when I was in High School.

Awesome, don't room with someone you know. Best way to meet new people. Love living among my fellow engineering classmates. I am President of our dorm association and it is a great way to get experience with leadership and meeting your fellow dormers.
Is very hard, but lots of support available. Writing support was awesome my first semester. Your advisor is your friend and is there for you.
Small enough that you feel safe. Lots of support with your studies. Can easily get involved with areas of interest groups, over 100 groups on campus to be part of.

Awesome rates compared to other Universities with the same rankings. Awesome Advisor, knows my name and is always there for help. Awesome students and staff, the majority are hard working small town kids with the same values and goals as myself.
pageTitle: North Dakota State University Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {293117=- Have an extremely warm winter coat, hat, gloves, boots, scarves, and long johns. It gets really cold in Fargo with the wind. - Do not let one teacher/professor make you rethink your major. Where there is one bad teacher there are ten great ones. - Join organizations that you find interesting and want to support or start your own organization. - Set an alarm for 7:55 am on Mondays when football tickets go on sale. Make sure you are logged on at 8 am or you may not get a ticket to the game and that is no fun., 328975=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 38261=Food is really good compared to other cafeteria style dining. It has its ups and downs. I don't prefer their asian food, but man is their burger bar the best thing ever. Take advantage of the chocolate milk! And get creative with the grills. There's so much you can make on your own in the dining center! One down side I have is, all the dining centers are closed on the weekend except for The Residence Dining Center. It's a big bummer during the winter. Living in Dinan, I had to get some confidence to make the trek during -40 degrees in January., 221202=March over!!!!!!!!!!}

textAfterTable: Bang for the buck NDSU is not the costliest of colleges, but you really do get your bang for your buck. It is in a semi-rural area, the professors are very knowledgeable, and the people are just so friendly and welcoming. A great investment for any student. What to do for fun Attend sporting events! (especially Bison football games), join clubs/programs, rollerblade or bike around campus, visit the Wellness Center to either work-out or rock climb or even take part in one of the fitness classes such as Zumba! Food and Dining The dining centers at NDSU offer students with plenty of variety and the menus for each dining center are posted online each day so you can figure out which meal best suits you for the day. Very convenient, not too costly, and the food is definitely good! Dorm Life The high-rises are a great option. Pavek, Seim, Sevrionson, or Thompson are all nice options to live during your first, second, or third/fourth years if you chose to do so. The other older dormitories are also a great choice because they are located next to frequently visited buildings which makes it easy for students. The LLC apartments are very fancy
